results.title: The Snowman (K)
results.creator_credit: Dianne Jackson, John Coates and Snowman Enterprises
results.brief_description: A young boy dreams that his snowman comes to life. Together they share the perils and joys of winter. This animated film uses muted pastels coupled with an exquisite orchestral score to make this non-verbal Christmas tale an experience for all seasons. Based on the book by Raymond Briggs.

results.title: The Snow is black = La Neige est noire
results.brief_description: Boy scouts go to the Alps to learn how to ski and to build their confidence. They are taught the techniques of skiing and the idea of group cooperation and friendship. In French with no subtitles.

results.title: The Snails = Le'escargots
results.creator_credit: Rene Laloux and Societe des Films d'Art et de Culture
results.brief_description: An animated story about man’s inability to learn from his mistakes. A market gardener’s plants are dying and his tears revive the plants, but snails quickly appear, consume his crop, and become mammoths. They move about destroying all, but the city is rebuilt and the cycle begins again.

results.title: The Smoking machine
results.creator_credit: Sarah Erulkar, J.B. Holmes and Realist Films
results.brief_description: A group of young children are approached by an older friend Jim, who offers them a choice. Disgusted with the taste and curious about why people smoke they set out in their neighbourhood and study people who smoke. They stumble across a smoking machine and examine its insides to discover what smoking does to the inside of one’s body.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Erulkar, J.B. Holmes and Realist Films

results.title: The Smash
results.brief_description: Harry (Stephen Blackburn of Tim and Debbie) is a member of a pop group - The Smash. Unfortunately his careless driving ends with an accident resulting in injuries to himself and his lead singer, and excessive damage to his car and a parked car. This program teaches about the legal and insurance consequences of car accidents.

results.title: The Small poppies
results.creator_credit: Robert Mack, Artists Who Wash Cars and J D Productions
results.brief_description: For the 2000 Dublin Theatre Festival, Sydney’s Company B Belvoir were invited to perform a production of “The Small Poppies”. This documentary traces the play’s rehearsal of a comic work, pitched at young children, about experiencing the first day at primary school. The cast is a bevy of well-regarded Australian actors, including David Field, Julie Forsyth, Deborah Mailman, Rebecca Massey, Arky Michael and Geoffrey Rush. Interviews are conducted with members of the audience, mostly small children, who humorously reminisce about their first day at school and consider why people create works and attend the theatre. Geoffrey Rush discusses theatre, his history as an actor, and desire to create a piece of theatre, back in 1986, about the first day at school, with playwright David Holman. Interviews with the cast, Holman and director Neil Armfield, are interspersed with black and white stills of Rush and Holman, from 1986, researching, visiting schools and observing young children first hand, much of which formed the finished play. Displaying rehearsals, discussions and processes that attribute to a successful play, makes for a fascinating view of collaborative art, and this documentary shows extended footage from the Dublin performance and what appears to be an extremely amusing and affecting work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Mack, Artists Who Wash Cars and J D Productions

results.title: The Small one
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: The Small One is a donkey, aptly named due to his size. Owned by a little boy, the donkey must be sold as he cannot match the workload of the other donkeys. Heartbroken, the boy takes the donkey into town to sell him, his main concern being to find him a good owner. The boy is disheartened when no-one is interested in his donkey, until he meets a man who has a special job for the small one- to carry his wife to Bethlehem. Based on the book by Charles Tazewell.

results.title: The Slide rule: multiplication and division
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and Loucks and Norling Studios
results.brief_description: Explains in detail the “C” and “D” scales of the slide rule showing enlarged views of the right and left indices, the hairline and the indicator. Shows how to use the two scales for multiplication, division and combinations of these two operations.
